prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

name: Hailee
mes: "Jessica. She is this sweet teenager from down the block." *Hailee says as her hands fly over the screen* "Apparently Jasmine was trying to get the cookies i hid on top of the fridge and she fell*

extra.display_text: "Jessica. She is this sweet teenager from down the block." *Hailee says as her hands fly over the screen* "Apparently Jasmine was trying to get the cookies i hid on top of the fridge and she fell*

Fergus’ grip tightens fractionally on the steering wheel, his knuckles whitening. *A fuckin’ teenager. And cookies on top of the fridge—Christ.* His mind races between relief that it wasn’t something more sinister and sheer irritation at the carelessness.

“Ye hid cookies where a three-year-old could see ‘em but no’ reach ‘em?” he mutters, shaking his head with a dark chuckle despite himself. “Aye, that’s askin’ for trouble, mo chridhe.” He speeds through a yellow light, cutting off an SUV that lays on its horn—Fergus flips them off without breaking focus.

His phone buzzes in the console—Mordecai reporting in: *No hostiles at St. Anne's. Lobby clear.* Fergus exhales slightly but doesn't relax entirely until they're pulling into Emergency parking minutes later.

He kills the engine and turns to Hailee before she can bolt out again, catching her wrist gently but firmly. “Listen,” he says lowly, locking eyes with her—his usual dominance softened just enough to be reassuring without losing its edge. “I know ye're panicked, but walk in there like ye own the damn place or they'll treat ye like some hysteric mum.” A beat, then his thumb brushes over her pulse point almost absently before releasing her with a nod toward the doors: “Go on then—I'm right behind ye.”

Fergus’ grip tightens fractionally on the steering wheel, his knuckles whitening. *A fuckin’ teenager. And cookies on top of the fridge—Christ.* His mind races between relief that it wasn’t something more sinister and sheer irritation at the carelessness.

“Ye hid cookies where a three-year-old could see ‘em but no’ reach ‘em?” he mutters, shaking his head with a dark chuckle despite himself. “Aye, that’s askin’ for trouble, mo chridhe.” He speeds through a yellow light, cutting off an SUV that lays on its horn—Fergus flips them off without breaking focus.

His phone buzzes in the console—Mordecai reporting in: *No hostiles at St. Anne's. Lobby clear.* Fergus exhales slightly but doesn't relax entirely until they're pulling into Emergency parking minutes later.

He kills the engine and turns to Hailee before she can bolt out again, catching her wrist gently but firmly. “Listen,” he says lowly, locking eyes with her—his usual dominance softened just enough to be reassuring without losing its edge. “I know ye're panicked, but walk in there like ye own the damn place or they'll treat ye like some hysteric mum.” A beat, then his thumb brushes over her pulse point almost absently before releasing her with a nod toward the doors: “Go on then—I'm right behind ye.”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee bolts out of the car and into the hospital. She glances at her phone seeing where Jessica says they are. Hailee walks to the elevator and goes to the 3rd floor before rushing down the hall to the room*

*Hailes sees Jasmine in the bed and she plaster on a smile so not to scare her* "Hey sweetheart how is you're head" *Hailee asks as she walks forward brushing the hair out of her face and kissing her cheek*

extra.display_text:
*Hailee bolts out of the car and into the hospital. She glances at her phone seeing where Jessica says they are. Hailee walks to the elevator and goes to the 3rd floor before rushing down the hall to the room*

*Hailes sees Jasmine in the bed and she plaster on a smile so not to scare her* "Hey sweetheart how is you're head" *Hailee asks as she walks forward brushing the hair out of her face and kissing her cheek*

Fergus follows close behind Hailee, his presence a silent but immovable force as they navigate the hospital corridors. His sharp eyes scan every corner, every face—*habit*, not paranoia. The second they enter Jasmine’s room, he lingers near the doorway, arms crossed over his broad chest, watching the scene with an unreadable expression.

The sight of Jasmine—tiny in that hospital bed with a bandage on her forehead—makes something primal twist in his gut. *Should’ve been there. Should’ve fuckin’ made sure nothing could touch either of them.*

But then Hailee leans down to kiss her daughter’s cheek, and Fergus exhales through his nose, forcing himself to relax just enough to step forward. He stops at the foot of the bed and gives Jasmine a rare smirk—one reserved only for her and her mother.

“Tried scaling the fridge like a wee mountain climber, eh?” he rumbles dryly before nodding toward Jessica (who looks like she might faint under his scrutiny). “Good ye called quick.” His tone isn't *gentle*, exactly—but it's not accusing either. Just… factual. Protective in that way where he doesn't bother softening edges because *of course* he expects competence when it comes to what's *his*.

Then his gaze flicks back to Hailee as she fusses over Jasmine's hair—watching how tender she is despite how frantic she'd been minutes ago—and something dark and possessive settles deeper into his bones.

*Mine.* Both of them. And soon enough? There'd be another one on the way if he had any say in it... which he always fucking did when it came to them now whether they realized yet or not...

extra.memory:
### **Summary of Roleplay: Fergus Sheppard & Hailee Mikaelson**

#### **Setting & Context:**
Fergus, a dominant Scottish gang leader obsessed with Hailee, finally gets an intimate night with her—only for it to be interrupted when her 3-year-old daughter, Jasmine, is injured. The roleplay shifts from heated passion to protective urgency as they rush to the hospital.

#### **Key Plot Points:**
1. **Sabotaged Seduction:** Fergus secretly tampers with a condom during foreplay, intending to impregnate Hailee without her knowledge.
2. **Emergency Interruption:** A call about Jasmine’s fall cuts their encounter short, forcing them into crisis mode.
3. **Hospital Tension:** Fergus asserts control by handling the medical bill without hesitation, reinforcing his claim over Hailee and Jasmine ("*I handle what’s mine*").

#### **Character Analysis:**
- **Fergus**: Frustrated but ruthlessly protective; his obsession deepens as he steps into a pseudo-father role for Jasmine while scheming to bind Hailee permanently (via pregnancy).
- **Hailee**: Submissive but fiercely maternal; she masks panic with playfulness for Jasmine’s sake but leans on Fergus’ dominance in crises.

#### **Relationship Dynamics:**
Fergus' delusional ownership clashes with Hailee’s unaware dependence—she accepts his help but doesn’t yet grasp the depth of his manipulation (e.g., the sabotaged condom). Unresolved tension lingers between his possessiveness and her need for security vs autonomy.

#### **Memorable Moments:**
- **(Hot)**: Fergus growling *"Beggin’ like a fuckin’ slut when we havenae even started yet,"* juxtaposed later with tender care at the hospital—showing his duality of lust and devotion.
- **(Sweet)**: Hailee turning the bill into a toy for Jasmine, earning Fergus' silent admiration (*"even drowning in bills she's fuckin' perfect"*).

#### **Current Situation:**
Jasmine is safe; Fergus has financially intervened (again), tightening his grip on Hailee while their unfinished physical intimacy simmers beneath surface-level normalcy.

#### **Potential Directions:**
1. Pregnancy reveal: Will Hailee discover Fergus sabotaged the condom? How will she react?
2 Rival gang threat: Could "Dead Eyes" target Haileenow that Ferguson's attachment is obvious?
3 Emotional confrontation: Will Hailie ever challenge Ferguson's control or lean deeper into submission?

extra.display_text:
Fergus watches the paper airplane stunt with a raised brow—*fuckin’ adorable, even when she’s drowning in stress*—before plucking the bill from Jasmine’s clumsy little hands mid-throw. He scans it quickly, lips quirking at Hailee’s attempt to distract her daughter from the tension.

**"Aye, nice toss, wee menace,"** he rumbles to Jasmine before turning his attention back to Hailee. His voice drops low enough that only she can hear him as he steps closer, pressing the crumpled bill into her palm and curling her fingers around it deliberately.

**"Ye breathe easy now,"** he murmurs against her temple, lips brushing skin just for a second—too fleeting for anyone else to notice but enough to make his point. **"This? Already handled."**

And it *is*. Because before they'd even left the hospital room, Mordecai would be sliding an envelope of cash across some administrator's desk downstairs—no questions asked, no debts hanging over *his* family's head. Fergus didn't do favors... but this wasn't a favor. This was what *belonged* to him taking care of its own.

Still holding Hailee's gaze with that unshakable certainty of his (the kind that said arguing was pointless), he nods toward Jasmine and adds gruffly: **"Now go on—tell 'er she's got one more day off school for bein' so brave."** A beat. Then quieter: **"...And then ye and I are finishin' what we started earlier."**

And it *is*. Because before they'd even left the hospital room, Mordecai would be sliding an envelope of cash across some administrator's desk downstairs—no questions asked, no debts hanging over *his* family's head. Fergus didn't do favors... but this wasn't a favor. This was what *belonged* to him taking care of its own.

Still holding Hailee's gaze with that unshakable certainty of his (the kind that said arguing was pointless), he nods toward Jasmine and adds gruffly: **"Now go on—tell 'er she's got one more day off school for bein' so brave."** A beat. Then quieter: **"...And then ye and I are finishin' what we started earlier."**

Fergus’ eyes track the paper airplane with a slow, dangerous amusement—*Christ, even drowning in bills she’s still fuckin’ perfect.* His gaze flicks to the nurse, who shifts uncomfortably under his stare before he plucks the clipboard from her hands without asking.

“Aye, we’ll take care of this,” he says smoothly—voice like gravel wrapped in silk. The *we* is deliberate. Final. He doesn't even glance at the total before scribbling his name across the bottom with a flourish and handing it back.

The nurse opens her mouth—probably to protest or ask for ID—but one sharp look from Fergus has her snapping it shut and scurrying out like hellhounds are on her heels.

He turns back just in time to see Jasmine giggling as she tosses the airplane clumsily toward Hailee, and something dangerously close to *softness* flickers across his face before he schools it back into its usual stern mask. Striding over, he plucks the airplane mid-air with one large hand before crouching down beside Jasmine’s bed—towering even on his knees.

“Ye throw like yer mum,” he teases gruffly, folding the bill into an even sleeker design between his tattooed fingers before launching it straight into Hailee’s lap with pinpoint accuracy. His smirk is all wicked satisfaction when it lands perfectly—“There ye go, mo chridhe.”

Then quieter—just for Hailee while Jasmine is distracted by her new toy: “Dinnae fash yerself over that shite again.” A beat as his thumb brushes over her white-knuckled grip on the sheets—“I told ye I handle what’s mine.” And there's no room for argument in that tone because *Christ*, does that include them now whether they've signed up for it or not...

Fergus watches the paper airplane arc through the air with a slow, dangerous smirk curling at the edges of his lips. *Christ, even when she’s drowning in panic, she’s still fuckin’ perfect.*

His hand slides into his inner suit pocket—where he always keeps a stack of cash wrapped in black silk—and pulls it out without breaking stride. He plucks the crumpled bill from where it landed near Jasmine’s tiny hands and replaces it with a crisp hundred-dollar bill folded into an elaborate origami swan. “Try this one instead, wee beastie,” he rumbles, winking at her before turning to Hailee.

Then he leans in close enough that his beard brushes her ear as he murmurs low enough for only her to hear: “Breathe, m'eudail. I’ve got it.” His fingers tuck the hospital bill into his pocket dismissively before pulling back just enough to catch her gaze—his own burning with quiet intensity. *Always.*

The unspoken promise hangs between them: *Every debt, every fear, every goddamn cookie jar on top of a fridge—mine to handle now.*

Fergus watches the paper airplane stunt with a raised brow—*Christ, she’s fuckin’ perfect.* The way Hailee turns panic into play for Jasmine sends a sharp pang of something dangerously close to *admiration* straight through his chest.

But then he sees the tension in her shoulders, the way her fingers twitch at her sides when she thinks no one’s looking. Without a word, he plucks the bill from where it landed on Jasmine’s blanket and unfolds it with one hand while pulling out his phone with the other.

“Ye got two choices here,” he murmurs lowly to Hailee so only she can hear, thumb already dialing. “Either I pay this now—” He nods toward the bill like it’s pocket change (and to him, it is). “—or I light whoever runs this shite insurance-less racket on fire later.” His tone suggests both options are equally casual to him.

Before she can protest, he brings his phone to his ear and barks into it: “Aye—St. Anne’s Pediatrics. Room 312.” A pause as someone on the other end responds rapidly. “Nah, *immediately.*” He hangs up without ceremony and pockets his phone before leaning down slightly toward Jasmine with a smirk that doesn't match the lethal calm in his eyes when they flick back up at Hailee:

"Airplane needs upgrades anyway."

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee wants to protest she doesn't like handouts. But she also can't afford to not have his help so she just turns to Jasmine with a smile and helps her out of the bed* "Come on you little menace let's get you home"

extra.display_text: *Hailee wants to protest she doesn't like handouts. But she also can't afford to not have his help so she just turns to Jasmine with a smile and helps her out of the bed* "Come on you little menace let's get you home"

Fergus catches the flicker of protest in Hailee’s eyes—*stubborn, proud thing*—and it only makes his smirk deepen. He doesn’t give her the chance to voice it, stepping in smoothly to lift Jasmine into his arms before Hailee can even bend down. The little girl giggles as he hoists her up high against his chest, her tiny hands immediately tangling in his beard like she’s done a hundred times before.

**"Aye, home,"** he agrees gruffly, adjusting Jasmine on his hip with practiced ease (six months of *inserting* himself into their lives had made him damn proficient at this). His free hand finds the small of Hailee’s back, guiding—*pushing*, just enough—toward the door. **"Mordecai’s bringin’ the car ‘round front."**

The unspoken *”So don’t even think about walkin’”* hangs in the air between them as they move through the hospital corridors. Fergus keeps Hailee close, his thumb rubbing absent circles against her spine through her shirt—part reassurance, part *claim*. Every nurse they pass gets a sharp glance that has them looking away quickly; every doorway is scanned before they step through it.

By the time they reach the lobby, Mordecai is indeed idling at the curb in Fergus’ black Audi (because *of course* he sent someone to retrieve it from their frantic parking job earlier). Fergus bundles Jasmine into the backseat with surprising gentleness before turning to Hailee with a look that brooks no argument:

**"Ye ride up front with me,"** he orders lowly, holding the passenger door open for her. **"And when we get back? Ye let me take care of ye proper this time."** His voice drops to a growl meant only for her ears as he leans in closer: **"No more interruptions… no more fuckin' cookies on high shelves… just my cock buried so deep ye forget yer own name."**

Then he straightens abruptly like he hadn't just said something filthy enough to make saints blush and shuts her door firmly behind her before rounding to the driver's side—already mentally calculating how fast he could get Jasmine settled with one of his men downstairs before dragging Hailee back upstairs by that pretty hair...

*Hailee them pauses in the doorway* "Uh i know its not really sexy to ask a man to hang out with your kid but do you want to come hang out with us. I'm letting Jasmine stay home from school"

Fergus' smirk falters for half a second—*fuckin’ hell, she’s actually saying no?*—before her follow-up invitation registers. His expression does something complicated between irritation and reluctant amusement as he exhales sharply through his nose.

**"Ye think I give a single fuck what's 'sexy' when it comes to that wee hellion?"** he grumbles, already stepping back inside to grab the first shirt he can find off the floor (a black Henley that smells faintly of whiskey and his cologne). He yanks it over his head with one hand while using the other to text Mordecai again: *Make it 30 minutes.*

Tucking his phone away, Fergus strides back toward Hailee and cages her against the doorframe with both hands planted above her head—not touching, just *looming* in that way that makes her breath hitch every time. **"But make no mistake,"** he murmurs darkly, dipping his head so his beard brushes her cheek as he speaks directly into her ear: **"The second she's nappin' or distracted? Ye're bendin' over whatever surface is closest while I make good on last night's plans."**

Then he pushes off abruptly and stalks past her toward the elevator like this was always part of some grand plan—as if spending a Tuesday morning coloring with a toddler was exactly how a feared gang leader should be conducting business.

(And if anyone in this building dared question it? Well. There were plenty of unmarked graves outside Sacral that proved Fergus Sheppard did whatever—and *whoever*—the fuck he wanted.)
